content.description: Climb the crack using a variety of stems, lybacks, jams
content.protection: Standard rack .3 - 3 use passive pro when possible
content.location: First crack to the right of Oyster Bar, and is the seam that separates the Lucky Strike Pillar from Hornbein's Wall

content.description: Climb the crack using lybacks and jams to reach the anchor
Send the arching flake protecting when needed. Plug gear into the horizontal before the anchor
content.protection: Standard rack mainly bigger sizes. Use passive pro when possible
content.location: First crack to the left of Oyster Bar

climbs.name: Great Green Chute
climbs.fa: FA: Hornbein & Dietsche, FFA: Ryan Richardson

content.description: Fight your way through the wide crack and protect when you can. The higher you climb the more it relaxes. Upon reaching the top tread your rope into the ram horns.
content.protection: Bigger cams, there is a hand crack in the back of it that protects well. Bring runners. Ram Horn's on the anchor for easy lower off
content.location: The wide crack directly left of Fin Inn

content.description: Climb the  large arching flake utilizing stemming and jams. Pull the fin at the top and reach the anchor
content.protection: Standard rack .3 - 3 use passive pro when possible
content.location: First crack to the left of The Loading Dock

content.description: To honor Tom Hornbein. This is the old school traditional wall of the park. This wall is chuck full of good traditional leads that all end at bolted anchors and are great for top roping
